website_summaries.verdict: Counting, addition, subtraction, sequencing, and creative construction are just a handful of ways to use these interlocking cubes. Exceptionally useful for learning and just as much fun for free play.
pros: Brings a helpful physical and visual element to basic mathematical equations
Each cube features a variety of geometric shapes
Comes with a handy activity guide, specially created by a mathematics lecturer
Great for learning and play time
cons: Lots of pieces for parents to keep track of

customer_reviews.title: This has been a life changing toy for our family. Huge development leaps for my
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old son is on the spectrum and has taken a liking recently to numbers. This has quickly become my sons favorite toy. We have purchased multiple sets. He’s a big fan of a YouTube channel called “number blocks” and he loves to make rows of them color coded like on those videos. It’s made counting and addition so fun for him. Thank you for such a wonderful product that has made a huge impact on his development.
customer_reviews.author: Erica spivey

customer_reviews.title: Number blocks for toddlers
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loves the show “Number Blocks” on Netflix and watches it religiously. So I bought these blocks because of their close appearance to the characters. He loves them! He is obsessed with counting and doing very well with addition and subtraction problems using the blocks and counting along with the show. I 100% recommend for toddlers who enjoy counting/math skills building.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Adams

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not great.
customer_reviews.text: I like that these have shapes within the blocks for further concepts. I like the variety of colors versus unifix cubes. In my opinion, they do not stay clicked together very well. They’ll do the job, but I’ll still be looking for more durable ones to add to the collection.
customer_reviews.author: bkluvr

customer_reviews.title: Love love love!
customer_reviews.text: We have used many blocks like these. I was hesitant because others were very hard for my kids to connect. They LOVE these and I am amazed at what they build out of them. They can be used for teaching and for play!
customer_reviews.author: Sab

customer_reviews.title: My oldest was so excited 😆!!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old recognized these from her school and was so excited to see them. Since I’m planning to home school it’s really helpful to have things that remind my oldest of her classroom and things that she’s familiar with using. I love how it’s a variety of common colors. They attach and detach from each other really well. They are light, yet sturdy fur stacking. Most importantly for me, 2 of my younger kids are also enjoying them (ages 2 and 4). Very age appropriate product. I like it.(lol yes my kids were back to back lmao) #instaTeam
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase for an even greater purpose!
customer_reviews.text: These are the perfect cubes for math and sorting! Kiddoes can sort them by color or by shapes. They come with an Activity Guide which is a nice addition to help get the creative juices flowing. They are the perfect size for both big and little hands! The colors are vibrant and contain little shapes on each block (for sorting). They have a slight texture to them, which is helpful so that they don’t slip out of little fingers. Great purchase for a even greater purpose!
customer_reviews.author: Marcie

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My 4yr old daughter loves these. We do some basic addition and subtraction, lots of patterns, and she loves to "build" with these.
customer_reviews.author: JOY

customer_reviews.title: love these for kids
customer_reviews.text: Love using these to help kids with math. They connect top-to-top or side-to-side so you can show tens in a single line or tens as two lines of 5 (like a traditional 10-frame). The easily pop together and stay together but are easy to pull apart, even for little ones in K & 1st grade.
customer_reviews.author: hcp22

customer_reviews.title: Colorful, Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: There are so many uses for these math cubes. In addition to great hands-on math learning, these cubes can be used for free play. Kids love to build letters, vehicles, buildings, and use their imagination with these cubes. Each cube has a shape on its sides, making them easy to touch and count, and learn about shapes too. The colors are bright. Cubes are durable. Preschool and elementary kids enjoy using these cubes. The kids were able to connect and disconnect them, even a 3 year old could do it. This was also good fine motor practice! I would purchase the math cubes again.
customer_reviews.author: News2you

customer_reviews.title: Nice price and quality
customer_reviews.text: Really simple math cubes that remind me of my childhoold 30+ years ago. For the price I was expecting them to be a bit cheaper feeling but these are nice. They don't seem like they will lose their sticky-ness even after a lot of use. The bag is a bit tight so cleanup is mostly a parent's chore, but that's not a big deal.
customer_reviews.author: zeroorone

customer_reviews.title: Great for Visual Illustration
customer_reviews.text: These blocks are great for helping my 4 yr old with counting numbers, adding, and subtraction. The blocks come with a user friendly guide and shows you how you can use it even for multiplication. Great hands on, and allows me to appeal to the tactile side of my daughter since she can touch and manipulate the blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo

customer_reviews.title: 3 year old loves these
customer_reviews.text: These blocks were good. My 3 year old can take them apart and attach them back. Not on first try but he got a hang of it fairly quickly. Although these attach well, stacking 30 blocks and holding it on one end horizontally will break off. I have tried making a sword out of them. It broke off at around stacking 25 of them. Not all of them are identical. So some attach tighter than others. My 3 year old loves playing with these and only complained initially. Now that he played with them for a while, he knows the limitations and is able to work with them around.
customer_reviews.author: Dandy Yung

customer_reviews.title: Keeps my son entertained!
customer_reviews.text: My son is 4 3/4. A friend of ours had similar ones and let us borrow hers. After a few weeks of him playing with them constantly, I bought these. I really like that they have the different shaped holes and you can make more complicated patterns than just color patterns. There is a show called Number Blocks and my son pretends these are them. He has learnt to do simple math with them and self engages with them. We just leave them out on our coffee table and he just plays with them whenever he is in the living room.
customer_reviews.author: Chandra

customer_reviews.title: Perfect learning tool for math
customer_reviews.text: Remote learning must have! My son loves these. He had them in his kinder room last year and when I found out this year would be remote these are one of the first things I bought. We’ve only used them a couple times so far, but he’s already doing multiplication with them. The colors are bright and vivid. They are easy to snap together and take apart. They really are a great learning tool.
customer_reviews.author: monniewolf

customer_reviews.title: Math manipulatives
customer_reviews.text: Bought the cubes for my 2nd grade son who is a tangible learner. I like that they are not huge but not teeny tiny. I read that other brand cubes are harder to click on so I don’t seem to have any issues so far. I am happy with the cubes.
customer_reviews.author: Joyfulmamaof3

customer_reviews.title: Kids love them and they help with math
customer_reviews.text: These are so much better for young children than the Learning Resources brand. They are easier to snap and un-snap together. If you are trying to build cubes or shapes you may be a little frustrated as they sometimes fall apart/un-snap easily. For older kids trying to build cubes or other shapes I recommend Learning Resources version. For younger kids counting and playing I definitely recommend this brand.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Multiple use
customer_reviews.text: Bought them for math. My son made robots out of them. Not disappointed at all. 10/10 would purchase again lol.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Wheeler

customer_reviews.title: Just Like The Ones Kids Use At School
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for distance learning and I'm very glad I did. They are exactly like the ones my kids use at school and have been very helpful with math. I have a preschooler, kinder and 1st grader. I am also very impressed by how inexpensive they were for the price and how sturdy they are. I would recommend to any parent.
customer_reviews.author: Mariah Foster

customer_reviews.title: A fun and easy way to learn
customer_reviews.text: They work wonderful for my sons first grade math he has fun while learning. he's learning to count with rods and units and these are just perfect for that. They also work as counters or to create a unique design by connecting the pieces together since all sides can connect to another cube. Im very happy with these.
customer_reviews.author: DeBee

customer_reviews.title: Oh the possibilities!!!
customer_reviews.text: My kids love these cubes! They are just the right size for their little hands and very sturdy! They mostly use them for math concepts but they also use them as little building blocks. They also enjoy the different shapes on the sides! Overall very versatile and can be used in different ways! I really do recommend even as a gift!
customer_reviews.author: Msanch20

customer_reviews.title: Incomplete Set/ Missing Pieces
customer_reviews.text: Incomplete set. Missing 6 pieces. I never liked the inconvenience of returning items.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: montessori math help
customer_reviews.text: We use these for a modified montessori style math for my pre-k child (first grade math level). They are great for counting, creating patterns with colors and shapes (each side of the cube is a different shape), arithemtic, etc. Easy for little hands to practice fine motor, easier to take apart and put together than lego!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Our 3 year old is now obsessed with these! We paired them with the show Number Blocks and we are ecstatic his new favorite toys involve learning and math! Highly recommend to pair with Number Blocks the show available on streaming.
customer_reviews.author: Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Excellent buy!
customer_reviews.text: GREAT learning toy! I bought them to use as tangible counters for my Kindergartener that I am homeschooling, but ALL of my kids love them! They love using them to count, sort colors and shapes, and build structures! (Ages 2, 4, and almost 6). My Mom actually just bought 3 more packs so that all 4 of my kids can have their own! :) Suprisingly sturdy, great versatility, and unbeatable price!
customer_reviews.author: Skye R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy for little hands
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these after getting a similar set from Learning Resources, which I found too stiff for small hands to use easily. These ones are perfect! All the same great features for hours of play and learning, and you can actually get THESE ones apart and together easily!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for sorting and math basics
customer_reviews.text: My kids love them! It makes my visual learner son understand math concepts. I researched and I think I found the best price for the number of blocks included. They are good quality as well with a nice surface, definitely not cheap plastic like ones seen on dollar stores.
customer_reviews.author: Jansen

customer_reviews.title: this is a good learning tool for kids
customer_reviews.text: My grandson watches number blocks so I got them for him and he loves them except that we got a few pieces that are not shaped the same (see picture above) so they don't quite stack together, I don't want to return the product and I wish I could get them replaced. If this could be done I would be very grateful!
customer_reviews.author: FLOR M CASCIO

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Using this in my homeschool to help my son learn addition and subtraction. I almost bought the more expensive brand and am so glad I didn’t! These snap together very easily and stay together. Easy for myself to use as well as tiny hands . Colors are vibrant
customer_reviews.author: Briana Brady

customer_reviews.title: Very useful, kiddos approve and educational!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for distance learning. We have a kindergartener and second grader who utilize these for daily learning. Also use these for a play manipulative in our family daycare. The kiddos love to color sort and build with these. Great price for the amount received and quality.
customer_reviews.author: H

customer_reviews.title: great math tools
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loves the show numberblocks so I bought these and they are a hit. She loves when I give her math problems and she can manipulate the blocks to find the answers. I will be ordering a second set because she loves them so much she took them on vacation and even wants to sleep with them.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Tran

customer_reviews.title: NUMBER BLOCKSS!!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter went through a number block phase.. she would watch it all the time on YOUTUBE so we got this for her... it helped her with her math and creativity we sword fight at least once a day with this haha
customer_reviews.author: Jaehee L.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and a great purchase
customer_reviews.text: These cubes are great for kids to use for math manipulatives. They are sturdy and stack up easily. The cubes have shapes on each side. Kids can make color and shape patterns. My kids also use the cubes to build different structures. These are amazing for open-ended activities.
customer_reviews.author: Yvette

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, fun to play!
customer_reviews.text: These cubes are of great quality. My 3 yr old and 5 yr old really love them and spend a lot of time playing with them. They love it so much that I decided to buy more - I bought another brand which looks just the same as this one on pictures but with larger package, and when I received the product I found the quality is not the same at all - hard the snap on, doesn’t hold up well after snapped on. I just realized how good this one is and will return that product and order more of these again!
customer_reviews.author: JenW

customer_reviews.title: Good quality - good function
customer_reviews.text: We have two sets. Exactly what we were looking for. I've used these with my pre-k and Kindergarten kids. Sturdy enough to stick together but easy enough for little hands to split apart so they can count individually. Cubes can attach on all sides so can make more than just straight lines. Colors are vibrant - we are happy with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: KEVIN J BINNS

customer_reviews.title: Math made easy
customer_reviews.text: My absolute favorite teaching tool. It makes addition and subtraction as easy as could possibly be. Using different colored blocks, you can simply snap off, or snap on, making a great visual and kinesthetic learning tool for math.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Great For Any Age
customer_reviews.text: This product is great for many reasons. It is multiple colors, shapes on the cubes and very easy for younger kids to pull them apart when practicing math. I would recommend this product to any mom or teacher!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Carter

customer_reviews.title: Number Blocks for the win!
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old is obsessed with the show NumberBlocks and got this so he could play along with while watching. The amount of math he's been able to pick up while playing along is fantastic. I heard him doing division and multiplication problems. I ordered another package so he could go number block crazy!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy I. Schwenk

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old daughter loves these! They are easy to manipulate/snap together and even though I purchased them primarily for working on her math skills, they are also conducive to more open ended play.
customer_reviews.author: lma

customer_reviews.title: Great for learning place value for 2nd grade.
customer_reviews.text: Great quality, awesome for learning place value. I've had a hard time teaching my daughter "ones place" and "tens place". She gets really confused but these are hands on learning for her and make her feel really confident!
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: NOT Made in China
customer_reviews.text: These are the best quality math blocks. I have purchased bags. Will keep ordering. They are made in Taiwan; NOT CHINA
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: They add up !
customer_reviews.text: Great value and serves it’s purpose. I bought these for my son to use in Kinder. Kids like to play with these as toys also so they serve two purposes! Cool colors too!
customer_reviews.author: TCP

customer_reviews.title: Well made!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy with this product and our granddaughter really liked playing with them. She has known her colors for a long time she is 2 1/2 but loved stacking the colors together and counting them. Not to late to start them with doing math.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen Rose

customer_reviews.title: A Staple In Our Homeschool
customer_reviews.text: This is our second time purchasing these blocks and we love to use them as fun math manipulatives. They are very sturdy when linked together and have held up over the years. I only repurchased because we lost a few. No complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Nike Anderson

customer_reviews.title: Wish we got them sooner
customer_reviews.text: These cubes helps visualize math concepts. It helped with teaching my kid units of ten and place values less painfully than when we tried without them. Worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Peanut jelly and butter

customer_reviews.title: A fun way to learn
customer_reviews.text: These are great to use when teaching math skills. They are especially helpful when teaching place value. They are also helpful when teaching patterns, adding and subtracting.
customer_reviews.author: J. L. W.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for early learning!
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves them and is Learning so fast! She already says “pentagon” at 2 1/2. There are many learning options with these simple blocks. It’s awesome!!
customer_reviews.author: Sir Tee O.

customer_reviews.title: Just what we needed
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased with the quality of these cube counters. They’re being used for math homeschooling a kindergartener. They hold together nicely and have a great variety of color. Both my 3 and 6 year old enjoying creating things with them also.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: These are great connecting cubes. The material they’re made of isn’t super slippery and they snap together easily and securely. Very pleased with them!
customer_reviews.author: Christian R.

customer_reviews.title: Good tool.
customer_reviews.text: Only one way(side) to connect them. When connected, they easy come off. Serves its purpose, it is not a toy and don’t expect much. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: wolverine

customer_reviews.title: Great buy durable product
customer_reviews.text: My 4 year old loves them. Snap and unsnap easy. The variety of colors help with adding and subtracting. Make learning fun and more interesting
customer_reviews.author: RoxanneC504

customer_reviews.title: Amazed
customer_reviews.text: We love these! My kiddo is struggling in math and someone recommended these and bam!!! Visual learners and kinesthetic learners!
customer_reviews.author: trish

customer_reviews.title: Great for the imagination
customer_reviews.text: They promote creativity. The kids, young and old, enjoy them.
customer_reviews.author: N. Adams

customer_reviews.title: Even Better Than My Classroom
customer_reviews.text: The package that came seemed small to me, but these cubes are awesome, they are even better than the ones we have at the school where I teach. They seem well made and durable, and come with different shapes on the insides of the cubes, very cool.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Carlson

customer_reviews.title: LOOKS LIKE NUMBER BLOCKS
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is a big fan of number blocks. I told her she could make her own number blocks out of these toys. She could play with them all day.
customer_reviews.author: Emma

customer_reviews.title: Have to order more
customer_reviews.text: Counters come in so handy and these are perfect for showing place vaule and flats and rods if you purchase enough of them.
customer_reviews.author: Priscilla Rivers

customer_reviews.title: Great Counting Blocks!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Well made and easy for a 4yr old to snap in!!! Love these! Get this Edx Education brand. We previously bought the Learning Resources blocks which looks almost identical, and those were horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: Works as expected. Other ones in learning stores are quite expensive so it’s nice to have an affordable option like this.
customer_reviews.author: yaya

customer_reviews.title: Hands on learners, must have!
customer_reviews.text: Use these for building confidence in math skills. Addition and subtraction is much more fun with using blocks.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Richards

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year olds loves math and watching Number Blocks on TV. So this was the closest we could get for him to interact with the show. He doesn’t stop playing with them! They only complaint I have is the sturdiness. When he clicks the blocks together it seems they lose that snug fit and fall apart easily.
customer_reviews.author: Bridget Kashow

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I needed. They snap together well and are just the right visual for my child. They are a good size and fun to play with. We have already used them many months for math homeschooling.
customer_reviews.author: C & J

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: Really great quality, just wish they came with a bag for all the cubes! Oh well, we can buy our own bag! My daughter loves them!
customer_reviews.author: Sunny

customer_reviews.title: 5 yr old cant put these down
customer_reviews.text: 5 yr old love them. He is a math kid and loves counting, so these are great. keep them in the bag after use, this is a 100 piece set of small toys.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: excellent. buy them!
customer_reviews.text: These cubes are awesome and extremely helpful teaching math at home. And the fun colors make it that much better. I definitely recommend. No problems with the seller either.
customer_reviews.author: Mmerz

customer_reviews.title: Great for education.
customer_reviews.text: I like the color options, the sturdiness of the product. It will last for many years to come.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my son to use at home as a math manipulative. Little did I know how much he and his brother with love them! They play with them more than their LEGO building a variety of creatures that have a Minecraft look.
customer_reviews.author: rb_sherrie

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome! They are just right for my kids (4,6) to hold and learning math concepts! They are sturdy/durable/fit well together and easy to take apart and put back together. Get price as well!! Would recommend !
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Good quality. Fun!
customer_reviews.text: My son pretends these are NumberBlock toys. Loves them! Very durable
customer_reviews.author: Bugaboo

customer_reviews.title: Only 30 blocks
customer_reviews.text: We purchased a 100 pack, and it came partially filled with 30 blocks of mixed colors. The mailing package was not tampered with, the problem is with the company that provided the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job but cheaper quality
customer_reviews.text: Smaller than I expected. And cheaper plastic. Not for $12.99 maybe $6.
customer_reviews.author: Lucy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect to help my daughter with learning math. She loves using them.
customer_reviews.author: Adriene Davis

customer_reviews.title: Best blocks ever
customer_reviews.text: My son is a fan of the unification cubes at school so I got him these for Christmas and he loves them. They are sturdy, durable, colorful. Would recommend to a teacher or parent.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Math and other things
customer_reviews.text: My kids love them for math and other building projects. Better to step on than legos 🤪
customer_reviews.author: JoJo

customer_reviews.title: Must have
customer_reviews.text: These are great for our homeschool classroom. Very versatile and snap together nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Steck_

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and nice
customer_reviews.text: It is very useful. My son use this for his math and works out pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: oknamcho

customer_reviews.title: These are great!
customer_reviews.text: I love these cubes! I have ordered others that are similar - for instance, Learning Resources - but these are BY FAR the BEST!!! These actually fit together very well! One of my favorite purchases this year!
customer_reviews.author: Very happy customer!

customer_reviews.title: Simple with endless possibilities
customer_reviews.text: Simple but endless possibilities. My 4 year old son LOVES these things.
customer_reviews.author: Tsmommy9

customer_reviews.title: Great math tool!
customer_reviews.text: With my daughter having to do virtual/distance learning, this is turning out to be a great tool to help her master elementary math.
customer_reviews.author: KLMF

customer_reviews.title: Just what we where looking for
customer_reviews.text: Great for my pre schooler. We use for an online math class for counting.
customer_reviews.author: ERICKA S. G.

customer_reviews.title: Durable and useful
customer_reviews.text: Durable, useful in teaching math. As a homeschooling mom, this is useful for my four year old, nine yo, and 12 yo.
customer_reviews.author: TKl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and great material
customer_reviews.text: My kids have really gotten into the show Number Blocks so I thought they would like these and they love them. They build the characters (numbers) from the show with them, use them to work out math problems, and just build random stuff with them. They sturdy and easy to use for a 5 and 7 yr. old.
customer_reviews.author: Sonia Arostegui

customer_reviews.title: Good counting blocks
customer_reviews.text: My son loves these! He watches numberblocks and uses these while watching. Very good for young kids learning math.
customer_reviews.author: Sweetie

customer_reviews.title: Fun for all!
customer_reviews.text: Very sturdy. My 6 and 9 year old love playing this them and building. They don’t really use them for math though. But got them at a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Dana Swensen Faddis

customer_reviews.title: It all adds  up!
customer_reviews.text: My four year old grandson is using these to count, add and subtract.
customer_reviews.author: ethel

customer_reviews.title: Less than 100
customer_reviews.text: My todlers have been fighting for these. The description says set of 100, but we got way less than that and no wonder they did not have enough to play with. Returning!
customer_reviews.author: Chrysty

customer_reviews.title: Good for math
customer_reviews.text: My son is 6 years old and this has help him with math such as addition and subtraction. I recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Emely

customer_reviews.title: Great for math!
customer_reviews.text: I love these so much that I bought 2 sets! The cubes work great for math in pre-k to 4th, 5th grade! This makes adding and subtracting a breeze.
customer_reviews.author: Alina Bomar

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Both my 5 year old and 11 year old love these!
customer_reviews.author: Sara Faull

customer_reviews.title: My 5 year old loves these cubes!
customer_reviews.text: These are great quality! The cubes snap together easily and stay in place until pulled apart from one another.
customer_reviews.author: alexis

customer_reviews.title: Same as school uses!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what my child uses at school! He loves them and it helps reinforce what he learns in class.
customer_reviews.author: milipierce

customer_reviews.title: Awesome cubes for math and fun!
customer_reviews.text: I love these cubes. My son and I use them for math and for fun. Easy to use and lovely colors.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Number Blocks
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves them and his mom have to buy 5 more sets. He is 4 and can count up to 500 with the blocks help.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Obsessed!
customer_reviews.text: Kids are crazy for these they play with them every day nonstop.Seriously
customer_reviews.author: Jason. S.

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: Love these. Total quality for a great price. Love the feel to them. Not hard scratchy plastic
customer_reviews.author: Robin Hood

customer_reviews.title: DIVERSIFIED MATH LEARNING BASIC CUBES
customer_reviews.text: I work with many types of math to others including new areas.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great math cubes, building and color sorting for toddlers.
customer_reviews.text: Great math cubes and quality. Great for older kids to do math and build. Toddler may be harder since they are a bit hard to put together. But can be used as color sorting also. But for older kids are great. They won’t come apart as other cheap cubes.
customer_reviews.author: Luisana G.

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of Fun
customer_reviews.text: I loved these when I was little and my children love them now. Great for little builders and math games. I’m going to buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Kueen Berry

customer_reviews.title: Missing Pieces
customer_reviews.text: I like these but we are missing 5 pieces which is frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: Learning plus Fun
customer_reviews.text: Loved that my girls love playing with them. It helps with math for my older 1st grader and love how they help my pre-k little girl with shapes and hand coordination. Plus when not in educational use, they also like to have fun with them and build.
customer_reviews.author: Margie

customer_reviews.title: They’re really GREAT!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these based on the reviews and homeschool videos I’ve been watching. They’re really great. I got them yesterday, and my 4 yr Old and 5 yr old played with them for hours. Literally hours. I love how durable and soft they are. Im def gonna be buying more.
customer_reviews.author: Genesis/Tony

customer_reviews.title: So helpful!
customer_reviews.text: Love these for my kindergartener who is learning addition and subtraction. She loves using these and it makes learning fun. 100% recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Marie C.

product_meta.title: Edx Education Math Cubes - Set of 100 - Linking Cubes For Early Math - Connecting Manipulative For Preschoolers Aged 3+ and Elementary Aged Kids
product_meta.description: This set of 100 linking math cubes includes 10 different colors. Cubes link together on all sides and feature five different geometric shapes on five of the sides: circle, square, triangle, pentagon and hexagon. These cubes are an ideal STEAM resource for every home or classroom learning environment. They connect with an easy, soft click, making them appropriate for children aged 3+. The set of 100 math cubes comes with an Activity Guide, which provides inspiration and ideas for using the cubes as an early math manipulative. Perform problem solving and reasoning tasks by color only or by shape and color for more advanced/older users. || Size: 0.75" sides.
feature_bullets: CLEVER DESIGN -- These math cubes snap together with a soft click, making them an ideal fine motor, construction and creative activity for ages 3+.
INSPIRE LEARNING WITH SHAPES -- Five sides of each cube contain a different geometric shape to create more challenging activities: circle, square, triangle, pentagon and hexagon.

INCLUDES 10 COLORS -- Watch as your youngster learns the art of pattern making or how to apply colors to learn math concepts, such as addition and subtraction, with this set of 100 construction cubes.
EARLY STEAM ACTIVITY -- Give your child a fun introduction to counting, sorting, construction, creativity and arithmetic! Show them how to use sequencing and patterns to build early math skills.
HIGH QUALITY CONSTRUCTION -- Made with smooth-to-touch plastic and rounded edges, these linking cubes feel warm to hold and connect with a gentle click, which is satisfying for kids to hear.
TEACH EARLY MATH -- Use these Activity Guide included to teach math concepts such as: number problems, algebra, geometry, measurement, problem solving and reasoning.
